publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-442# Karen Gillon: European Week for Safety and Health—That the Parliament notes that the European Week for Safety and Health will take place between 13 and 19 October 2003; welcomes the week’s acknowledgement of the need to promote safety and health in the workplace; congratulates trade unions for the role that they have played in improving health and safety in the workplace, and commends the commitment of the European Agency for Safety and Health and the Health and Safety Executive to promote safe and healthy working.

S2M-442# Karen Gillon: European Week for Safety and Health—That the Parliament notes that the European Week for Safety and Health will take place between 13 and 19 October 2003; welcomes the week’s acknowledgement of the need to promote safety and health in the workplace; congratulates trade unions for the role that they have played in improving health and safety in the workplace, and commends the commitment of the European Agency for Safety and Health and the Health and Safety Executive to promote safe and healthy working.
S2M-442# European Week for Safety and Health (lodged on 1 October 2003) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-442# European Week for Safety and Health (lodged on 1 October 2003) Johann Lamont*, Christine May*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*

S2M-442# European Week for Safety and Health (lodged on 1 October 2003) Marilyn Livingstone*, Karen Whitefield*, Des McNulty*, Cathy Peattie*, Eleanor Scott*, Richard Lochhead*, Tommy Sheridan*, Margaret Jamieson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Scott Barrie*, Cathie Craigie*, Jackie Baillie*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-442# European Week for Safety and Health (lodged on 1 October 2003) Frances Curran*, Helen Eadie*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Watson*
S2M-442# European Week for Safety and Health (lodged on 1 October 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Marlyn Glen*, Trish Godman*, Chris Ballance*, Janis Hughes*

S2M-442# Karen Gillon: European Week for Safety and Health-That the Parliament notes that the European Week for Safety and Health will take place between 13 and 19 October 2003; welcomes the week's acknowledgement of the need to promote safety and health in the workplace; congratulates trade unions for the role that they have played in improving health and safety in the workplace, and commends the commitment of the European Agency for Safety and Health and the Health and Safety Executive to promote safe and healthy working. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone*, Ms Sandra White*
